descriptions.overview: This 21-in push mower is ideal for smaller yards. It has a 140cc Briggs and Stratton® ready start® engine with an easy and reliable starting system with no prime, no choke. The 3-in-1 deck allows you to mulch and help put nutrients back in your soil for a healthier lawn, bag for easy clean up or composting. The 8-in rear wheels provide improved maneuverability on any terrain, while the dual-lever 6 position height adjustment makes it easy for you to adjust the cutting height while mowing.
list: No prime, no choke with the 140cc Briggs and Stratton® engine featuring ReadyStart®
21-in, 3-in-1 convertible deck lets you side discharge, mulch or rear bag grass clippings
Dual-lever, 6 position height adjustment makes it easy to change cutting heights from 1.25-in-3.75-in high
Mulch kit included to help put nutrients back into soil for a healthier lawn
Rear bag collects grass clippings for easy clean up or composting
Adjustable loop handle for comfort while mowing
Proudly made in the USA with global materials in Tupelo, MS

reviews.title: "Great mower, nice price"
reviews.text: I just have a small yard, so a reliable push mower is all I need. I have had great luck with Briggs and Stratton engines in the past. Plus, Craftsman still make decent products. I have used it twice now and it cuts well, starts right up, the wheel adjustment levers are easy to use, and the bag comes on and off with ease. My only gripe is that mine came without an oil fill cap. I called the store, they were very apologetic and told me just to come back with the receipt and they'd give me one. That's what I did without an issue. Overall a great experience, but 4 stars for the missing part. The store staff all get 5 stars for being so friendly and helpful.
reviews.author: ShiftyBravo

reviews.title: "Great Mower"
reviews.text: Bought this mower after it went in sale for Spring.  Very happy with it.  Came out the box very easy to assemble.  One thing to keep in mind.  Add the engine oil before you you assemble the loop for the pull cord.  It makes it easier to extend the cord when it's not metal on metal parts trying to move past each other.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Efficient"
reviews.text: Nice mower.  Cuts like going through warm butter.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Yard needed bush hog- but Craftsman cleared it"
reviews.text: The low price fooled me. The reviews sold me, and this thing is a dream. It says "some assembly required" but it consists of just loosening some fasteners, pulling up the handlebar, and re-tightening fasteners & attaching grass bag, if you want to use it. Our yard was the bane of the neighborhood and the weeds were three feet high and thick. This went through them like a dream. What a great purchase. I had a fantastic photo of the 3ft tall weeds next to the mowed/cleared section with the mower, but Lowes site had problem(?) & wouldn't let me upload. Your loss! You wouldn't believe it.
reviews.author: PhoenixFlowersLady

reviews.title: "Lightweight and straightforward"
reviews.text: I'm really happy with this machine. I leveled down to a non–self-propelled model because I was tired of the added weight and clunkiness. This mower is just what I was looking for, and it starts right up every time. The gas tank is a little smaller than I'm used to: I can mow nonstop for about an hour before a fill up. The deck is two inches smaller than my Toro, but I don't care--that enhances the lighter weight I need. I feel like this mower is definitely higher quality that the least expensive push mowers on the market. Very happy with quality and price. I like that it's made in the USA, even if some parts are sourced offshore.
reviews.author: Julie

reviews.title: "Broken side discharge already"
reviews.text: just bought this 3 weeks ago. Love the way it moves. Nicely built with multiple opens to cut grass. However on my 2nd use the bolt snaps and now I have to find a way to get it off and replace.
reviews.author: Drew

reviews.title: "pushmower"
reviews.text: Yes, it is a gas powered mower, a no frills mower. Yes it cuts the grass, but....When it's time to change the oil, surprise, the engine lacks an oil drain plug. Consult the manual and learn that the oil must be drained through the oil filler. That means tilting and turning the machine which will cause any gasoline in the tank to also run out. To prevent that, the mower must be allowed to run out of gas before doing the oil change!The no throttle, no choke, "Ready Start" system works quite well right now, but will it be reliable in the years to come?  Time will tell.And I would not run the machine without fuel stabilizer added to my gasoline. Get it at any auto parts store and use it.
reviews.author: Howie

reviews.title: "Oil leak"
reviews.text: Bought from Lowe's. Opened box to find oil leaked in the box so someone must have returned it already and they just put it back on the shelf. Tried it anyway to see how we liked it. Ran for 2 min before oil leaked everywhere from mower and was smoking. We put in oil that came with it.
reviews.author: Kcmiller

reviews.title: "Read this if the engine is locked!"
reviews.text: Great machine, perfect for small lawns. Set up is SIMPLE, but you HAVE TO extend the handles because they go all the way down the blades, if you don't do this the cord will never move!The only thing That I would like to have in my case, is that the height adjustment its the same for both sides, meaning that you only have to adjust one side and both left and right adjust together, this is great, I just happen to have an uneven spot where I need it to be higher on the right side. I can live with that, it started right on with no problems the very first pull and with not so much effort!
reviews.author: Traveller001

reviews.title: "Great Lawnmower"
reviews.text: I bought this mower and was able to assemble it myself. The instructions were clear and easy. The mower did a great job. It handled well and it's very easy to operate.  I really like the deck wash feature to keep it clean and operational. I am 100% satisfied with this purchase.
reviews.author: Rose

reviews.title: "Great Lawnmower"
reviews.text: I bought this mower and was able to assemble it myself. The instructions were clear and easy. The mower did a great job. It handled well and it's very easy to operate.  I really like the deck wash feature to keep it clean and operational. I am 100% satisfied with this purchase.
reviews.author: Rose

reviews.title: "Good mower for the price"
reviews.text: I have a flat lawn so this is the ideal mower for my needs.  Little assembly out of the box required but simple and no tools needed.  Fired right up on first pull and worked great.  Only complaint is that it's louder than I thought it would be but it is a gas mower so there's going to be some noise.  So far so good.  My old Craftsman mower lasted 13 years and the motor still runs good but the deck is rusting out really bad so I broke down and got a new one.  Hopefully this one lasts a while too.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Best Mower On The Market Hands Down!!"
reviews.text: When I heard that Lowe's was doing away with Troy-Bilt, I was upset, but after seeing what I saw with the mowers and Craftsman I decided to go to Craftsman. Best decision ever! I love this thing. It's a powerhouse and is in my opinion better than Troy Bilt. Now time will only tell how long it will last. Very happy with my purchase!
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "perfect very heavy deck"
reviews.text: Live in FL sandy ground bought to trim our 20 yr old toro died, This has a heavy deck being a sheet metal craftsman I watch things, This has a smooth push even cut, only thing bagger fills up quick, this mower will outlast me!
reviews.author: DDG

reviews.title: "Fantastic mower"
reviews.text: I just bought this mower and " I LOVE IT ". I'm 73 years old and this mower is easy to handle. You can't go wrong with this mower
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.text: Good basic lawnmower. We have a 1/4 acre lot and it's exactly what we needed. Easy to start, easy to use.
reviews.author: Eric

reviews.title: "Craftsman push lawn mower"
reviews.text: Mower cuts well. Easy to handle. Only complaint is grass catcher bag is too small.
reviews.author: Tom

reviews.title: "Great mower!"
reviews.text: I love the no choke and primer feature. Easy to start. Utilizing the bag makes the yard look better afterwards. Always bought a cheap blend mower until this being g my craftsman and will never look back. Get the full replacement warranty!!
reviews.author: Army

reviews.title: "Best mower I ever owned"
reviews.text: This is by far the best little mower that I have ever owned! It worked right out of the box, mowed my entire 1/3acre lot on one tank of gas, and it never stalled or stuttered once!
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "Simple but Effective"
reviews.text: I needed to replace my mower.  This is very similar, with mulching and front-wheel drive.  It is lighter and easier to maneuver, better than my old Toro.  Simple assembly, easy start.   Very happy with this purchase.
reviews.author: BG10293

reviews.title: "Don't forget to pull thru the handles!"
reviews.text: Bought this mover to replace a larger self propelled model that had bad reviews. Could not pull out the cord until I looked under and noticed that the handles are not fully pulled thru.Once I pulled them in, the cord worked, it started well and is cutting well.
reviews.author: Jakob

reviews.title: "What a mower!"
reviews.text: I purchased the Craftsman M110 140-cc 21 inch gas push mower on 05-08-2019 at the Lowes store in Dayton, TN.  They assembled the mower for me and loaded it in my SUV.  I couldn't wait to get home and try it out.  This mower started right up on the first pull and mowed like a charm.  I am 71 years old and had absolutely NO problem with it at all.  All I had to do was add gas, and away I went. I HIGHLY recommend this mower!!
reviews.author: Blaze

reviews.title: "PLEASED SO FAR!"
reviews.text: We've only had the mower for a month, but it's doing the job just fine so far.  We got some handy tips from the staff too.  It's just before summer now, and we look forward to using this mower.  Glad this one comes with a bagger too.  For the price, it seems to be a great deal.
reviews.author: KK

reviews.title: "Nate from Braddock Hills"
reviews.text: I read the reviews on the 21in craftsman M110 lawnmower. The average review was 4.5 stars. Well I must say my review will definitely not lower the score. I'm giving this machine 5 stars+ (1) I am not mechanically inclined. In fact, working on any project usually stresses me out for days. This DID NOT happen with my craftsman. I brought it home by 6:30pm and exactly 20 minutes later I was finalizing the lawnmower by adding the oil (provided in box) and gas. The instructions were simple and the step by step pictures illustrated nicely what went where and why! Thanks! Oh one note several reviews mentioned that their lawnmowers were noisy. (Make sure you add the prescribed amount of oil BEFORE starting your mower) Needless, to say, my lawnmower was very quiet and cut like a hot knife through butter. My yard looks Good! Lastly, how can you go wrong with such a quality name brand backing the product, craftsman and Briggs and Stratton. Also with the excellent price of $219.00 plus tax. I can't wait to cut my yard again (I have just under a 1/2 acre mostly flat yard) I hope this helps.
reviews.author: nwjrone

reviews.title: "won't start after 2 years"
reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago, it never cut very well from the get go. Now, 2 years later, it won't start. My dad taught me how to winterize a lawnmower, and I did everything right.  I've watched videos about the problem possibly being abquick fix of the carb. Well, that's a quick fix after taking basically the entire lawn mower apart.Im a single mom, I work full time, and with all the other jobs with hoyse, laundry, etc; I shouldn't have to worry about fixing my lawnmower after 2 summers! Do not buy unless you want to play repairman as well.
reviews.author: steph

reviews.title: "Had to Return"
reviews.text: **Warning** I picked my "New" lawn mower with modest expectation.  Just wanted something that would start easy and run well.  I got neither.  My first hint I was in for problems was when my "new" lawn mower was full of oil.  Evidently, it hadn't been fully cleaned from the last guy who had returned it.  As expected... a lemon. I ended up returning it after it ran for a good...two minutes and then permanently died.  ***Warning about this product***
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "Worked great on tall grass"
reviews.text: Our previous mower stopped working in the winter. I wasn't worried about it immediately, but once spring came...the rain came with it. I couldn't mow because of the wet grass and once it dried I was in need of a new mower. I had some gift cards that hadn't been used yet, so I got this one. It had really reviews and a bag to catch the grass, which was just a bonus. It did a great job on my yard and managed the slopes just fine. Would absolutely recommend!
reviews.author: Steph

reviews.title: "Most Bizarre Mower"
reviews.text: Set up was very simple. Box comes with engine oil, so the only thing you need to provide is the fuel. After getting everything filled up, I went to get the pull cord into the holder, but couldnt even get it to unwind. The engine was completely locked up. After trying everything I could think of, including calling Lowes and reading reviews, I decided to look under the mower to see if there was anything in the way of the blades. The mower handles are shipped completely pushed thru the deck into the way of the blades. I have never seen or heard of a mower that has the handles go thru a hole in the deck. After pulling the handles out, of course it started right up. I am very interested to see if those holes will become a problem after several mowings. I havent seen any reviews complaining about the holes, so maybe the engineers figured out how to keep grass from escaping out of the deck...If anyone is having issues with the engine not turning over, check the underside before returning.
reviews.author: Jono

reviews.title: "Great lawnmower for price"
reviews.text: My yard is about a quarter acre and I was debating getting the self propelled version. Since my lawn didn't have any aggressively sized hills, I stuck with the push mower. I'm glad I did. The mower is quite light and easy to whip around. If you are debating getting a self propelled mower, consider the maximum slope of your yard and whether it will be a burden to push it up. If you have average strength, you will be fine with the push on a relatively flat lawn. The engine starts up very easily and has a self choking feature. Overall very impressed with this purchase.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Lemon"
reviews.text: Directions.  Fill oil and gas and starts within 2 pulls . I pulled til my hand started bleeding with no success . Lowes did accept return . I picked up mower and returned 1.5 hours later . I purchased a mower with a Honda mower at another box store . I told the clerk she can replace item but she ignored me and handed me my money back . I figured she did not want my business since she did not reply back so I took my money elsewhere.
reviews.author: Bert

reviews.title: "Easy to use"
reviews.text: Bought this lawn mower recently and it is very easy to use on my front lawn. Would definitely recommend this product
reviews.author: Diana

reviews.title: "Good little mower"
reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for an older craftsman.  This works very well, starts right up, and uses less gas.  It has proven very reliable so far.  I have not used the bagger that comes with it.  But with the mulching option, my legs don't even get clippings on them when I mow.
reviews.author: Hop

reviews.title: "In the Carolinas"
reviews.text: This mower got the job done.  the bag is a added perk.  Low dust. No need for upgraded dustless bag.
reviews.author: dal

reviews.title: "Great Replacement for a good price"
reviews.text: I needed to replace my mower and this was a great replacement...bag and all.Easy to put together..easy to use
reviews.author: Victor

reviews.title: "Great no frills mower"
reviews.text: Have only used it twice so far but I really like it. A little confusing putting it together in that I couldn't understand why the cord wasn't coming out until I realized that the handle needed to be pulled up out from under the base. Thank goodness because I was afraid I'd have to cut grass all bunched over! But it does great and I'm very happy with it. Thank you Lowe's!
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "Engine defect"
reviews.text: Purchased this mower in April.   Excellent function and use for just over a month. Loved it.  Started blowing oil.  Contacted craftsman and lowes warranty.  Repair shop had for 4 weeks trying to fix with no solution- even being in constant communication with Briggs and Stratton.  Not fixable and repair shop had at least 2 others of this mower show up with same issue - clearly a manufacturing defect.  Briggs and Stratton did not have a solution.  Returned mower.
reviews.author: Ash

reviews.title: "Craftsman m110 push mower"
reviews.text: Great engine, super easy and fast assembly. 3 options for side discharge, mulch or bag makes lawn work much easier and less time consuming. Handles and turns easily. Height adjustments quick and easy.
reviews.author: Jason

reviews.title: "Perfect For a Smaller Lawn"
reviews.text: We bought this to replace an older Craftsman mower, and the difference was great.  No more having to prime before starting, and it starts smoothly on the first pull with very little effort.  This mower probably does not have enough engine for a very large or hilly yard, but is perfect for an average sized city lawn.
reviews.author: Liz

reviews.title: "It took a minute to fix it"
reviews.text: We ordered this mower and picked it up in store. The box looked a little rough but they assured us it was fine. We put it together fairly easily when we got home. But when we went to test start it and pulled the cord, it snapped. It's a cheap little rope cord. We had to take it apart to fix it. Luckily my husband is a handy guy and spent a few hours doing this. Although the metal coil popped out at one point and it took us ages to get it back in because it has to be wound tightly. It was extremely frustrating for me. Now that it is fixed, the thing functions perfectly. Although I gave up on the bag because it gets heavy quick while mowing. I wish I could get some money back for all the time we spent fixing the stupid thing, but glad it works now. For now anyway.
reviews.author: Elizabeth

reviews.title: "Great mower; 1 flaw"
reviews.text: This is a great mower. Easy assembly. Starts in 1 pull all the time. No need to choke or prime. The 1 flaw is the gas cap. It easily comes off when mowing under bushes. It's a quarter turn cap but I think it needs to be a standard screw on cap.
reviews.author: Justin

reviews.title: "Craftsman"
reviews.text: Craftsman has always been the standard. Built for years to come.
reviews.author: Hams

reviews.title: "Craftsman Lawn mower"
reviews.text: This lawnmower was easy to assemble and the engine started with one pull. Easy to push around the yard and easy to empty grass from attached lawn bag. I'm satisfied with this inexpensive product.
reviews.author: Skbailey

reviews.title: "Easy to assemble, started on FIRST pull!"
reviews.text: I bought this mower to replace my 25 yr old Lowe's 22 in push mower.  Picked it up at my local Lowe's and brought it home. Took about 15 minutes to unbox it, read the assembly instructions and get it ready.  MAKE SURE you extend the handles per the instructions!  After filling it with oil and gas, it started on the FIRST pull.  This is a light duty mower, but easy to use and perfect for the 'detail' mowing I like to do after using my riding mower to the majority of my yard.  I'd recommend it!!!
reviews.author: MarkC

reviews.title: "A Great Little Mower"
reviews.text: This little gas powered push mower is perfect for anyone not wanting all the bells and whistles! From the box to operation took about 10 minutes...One thing to note...look under the mower and make sure the handle arms are pulled up and adjusted otherwise you won't be able to start it as it will seem like the pull rope is jammed... They even include motor oil so all you need to supply is the gas. It is lightweight and is easy to maneuver as it seems like it's as light as a feather...we didn't want the self driven motor as we have a few rock gardens and are constantly going forward and back and that's difficult with the self driven models...All in All a great little mower and well worth the price! We even got the extended warranty although our past Craftsman products have proven themselves and we have never needed to use it...We hope the same will be said of this little gem.
reviews.author: Dusti

reviews.title: "Junk"
reviews.text: Used twice (less than an hour total) and then would not start. Followed directions to the letter. No dice. Taking back.
reviews.author: DD

reviews.title: "Doesn't work"
reviews.text: Taking this mower back to Lowe's. Put it together, filled the oil, put gas in it, went to pull the cord and it wouldn't budge.
reviews.author: Freckles

reviews.title: "Small wheels = hard to push"
reviews.text: It's a little heavy to push because the wheels are small but otherwise it works great.
reviews.author: HillyD

reviews.title: "Great mower. Great quality."
reviews.text: Mower comes preassembled in the box.   Fill will oil provided, set desired cut height, adjusters are easily set.   Fill with fuel-not provided. No primer on mower.  Will start on first or second pull.   No issues.   Sounds great.  Mows great.  Easy to push and empty mulch bag
reviews.author: Moose

reviews.title: "Keep getting better!"
reviews.text: 3rd Craftsmen push mower in 27 years and this one is for my daughter. The last one we purchased 12 years ago is still going strong so no need in the foreseeable future for us to have the chance to own one of these new models for ourselves. The leveling has become much easier with the tandem rise and lower system. Started first pull just like I expected. She loves it and I loved buying it for her!
reviews.author: BruceL

reviews.title: "Mower"
reviews.text: Only used once so far but have no complaints. Just hope it starts every time and no trouble next season.
reviews.author: Cindy

reviews.title: "It cuts the grass."
reviews.text: There really isn't a lot to say about this mower. It's a no-frills mower that does exactly what you expect it to. CUT GRASS. The choke-less start is nice. So far starting the season out in the 60s it has started on the first pull every time. I do use ethanol free gas only in all of my yard equipment and since making that change everything works better.Bonus + for the included grass capture bag along with needed attachments if you decide not to use it.
reviews.author: Jdrames

reviews.title: "Craftsman Mower"
reviews.text: Bought the mower and brought it home. Unboxed and put it together. Pretty easy to configure. After putting in fuel and oil it started on the second pull. It works great
reviews.author: mochrist58

reviews.title: "Great Mower at A Great Price"
reviews.text: I was looking for a name-brand lawn mower at a reasonable price and Walmart (my usual go-to store) didn't provide that. So I was thrilled to find a Craftsman push mower at Lowe's for a little over $200. I viewed it online, but went to the store to get it. They had plenty in stock.I'm a heavy-set 53-year-old grandmother with breathing problems. This lawn mower is easy to assemble and push. It runs like a dream and starts on the first pull every time. I picked it up, unboxed it, and put it together myself. I just followed the directions as well as two tips from other reviews: 1) pull the handle up all the way and secure it first thing, 2) add the oil before securing the pull-start rope.I've used it three times now and am very happy with it. My yard is about .25 acre and mostly flat. I highly recommend this cute little lawn mower to anyone who's looking for an affordable, well-built unit without all the bells and whistles of more expensive brands.
reviews.author: DIYGramma

reviews.title: "Just what I needed"
reviews.text: Great product and cost efficient! Does exactly what you need it to do. Easy to operate and grass looks fantastic afterwards. The bag is useful but fills up pretty fast. However, the lawnmower definitely lives up to the Craftsman name.
reviews.author: SBM

reviews.title: "A low cost lawn mower and it shows"
reviews.text: My Troy-Bilt riding lawn mower died on me the other day and I have been working on it as I get time. I bought this mower as a fill in until I can get my rider back up and running. While it was not the absolute cheapest mower I could find it was cheap enough for a mower I will only occasionally use. There is, however, more plastic pieces on this mower then I have ever seen. They made every part they could out of plastic but I'm sure that's how the brought the price down. So far after a couple of uses it has held up fine. My only performance complaint is the side chute, it falls off with the slightest touch. It fell off when I pushed it through tall grass, or it I got to close to a tree and it rubbed up against it. I spent more time putting it back on then the lawn mower is worth.
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.text: we bought 2 of this model and they are better than any mower we bought previous over the last 18 years, we have had, toro, husquavarna, yard machine, murray and countless others and they don't even match or compare to these craftman mowers, we are very satisfied with our purchase. Thank you Lowe's
reviews.author: BMDeavor

reviews.title: "Good mower"
reviews.text: I like cutting the grass, so this push mower is ideal. It starts up easy and cuts cleanly. The reason for 4 out of 5 stars is because it jammed up once and I have only used it twice so far.
reviews.author: KT

reviews.title: "Excellent product"
reviews.text: After mowing several times I have determined that this is the best mower I have ever owned. It needs minimum assembly. Put the oil & gas in & you're ready to go. Height adjustment is simple. Decide on mulch, side discharge or bag. Fires up 1st pull & you're mowing. Light enough to handle easily. Cuts fine.  My old mower was a 10 yr. old Craftsman that was still running.  Just thought it's time for a new mower. Good decision.
reviews.author: Jay

reviews.title: "Awesome Mower"
reviews.text: Easy assembly, started on first pull, and cuts like a dream.Large fuel capacity, easy height adjustment, and grass catcherfills without clogging. What more could you ask?
reviews.author: Mack

reviews.title: "Push mower"
reviews.text: My son saved up to buy this mowing to mow grass this summer in the neighborhood. He has been extremely pleased with how easy it was to start and push!
reviews.author: Wes

reviews.title: "Man Mower"
reviews.text: This super simple mower is light and powerful. Ne frills, no whistles, just power.
reviews.author: One1sol

reviews.title: "Won't Start."
reviews.text: First time 3 pulls not the guaranteed 2.  Next week. Impossible to start, but got the best workout of my life trying.   Returning.
reviews.author: Rd

reviews.title: "Doesn't Start"
reviews.text: I spent 45 minutes trying to start the brand new mower and the pulley gets stuck and won't start. I'm returning the unit.
reviews.author: Scott

reviews.title: "Impressed"
reviews.text: Easy to put together then started on FIRST pull...lighter than I thought too...great for a average yard
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "Awesome mower!!"
reviews.text: I've never had a mower that didn't have to be primed at all. Just one pull and starts right up!
reviews.author: Jamie

reviews.title: "Pretty solid mower for the price"
reviews.text: Nice mower. Starts right up. Better than I expected for the price.
reviews.author: AC

reviews.title: "Craftsman Push Lawn Mower"
reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my daughter - she loves it!  great mower for small-to-medium sized lawns.  Easy to start. Love the mulching option.
reviews.author: LitlPoot

reviews.title: "Junk"
reviews.text: I bought this as “returned and repaired product”. Loaded it up, got gas, but it won't start. I think I'm more irritated with Lowe's right now tha the product for falsely saying they “repaired” it. I'm a woman, had to load this in my car, but a gas can and gas, unload the stupid thing myself. I'm annoyed with Lowe's and the crappy product.
reviews.author: TW

reviews.title: "Small yards only"
reviews.text: This was a stopgap when an old mower body gave out. It works, on smaller yards it is fine
reviews.author: SteveW

reviews.title: "RELIABLE AND LIGHT WEIGHT"
reviews.text: Free delivery in 2 daysEasy to assemble,  and the best part super light weight to push around.  Engine is semi quiet and starts with the 1st pull.My old cub cadet was self driven and not worth the repair so I went old school with this Craftsman, and glad I did. Please you mowing experience and give this one a try.MADE IN THE USA :)
reviews.author: Dallas

reviews.title: "Great mower for the price"

reviews.author: ANGRY

reviews.title: "A GR8 Mower for the Independent Woman! !<3 :-)"
reviews.text: My old mower- 20+ Years (Briggs & Stratton engine....yeah...baby) Finally gave up the ghost. Being a single-mom with no help and a small vehicle for transport I had to be very picky on the new addition to my landscape equipment. I got all my questions answered and felt confident when I purchased this little red-hottie at my local Lowes. The awesome female associate there assured me I could assemble this Craftsman M110 without any special tools..She helped me load it into the trunk of my car as well. #Lowesemployeesrock! I got it home, unpacked the box, looked over the one sheet quick-start-set-up guide....Piece of cake...Unloosen two bolts and the T-bolts to pull the handle up. My only hiccup was, as another poster noted. You have to pull the handle up all the way to the first hole in the bottom notches so you can pull the string to start it. IF ITS NOT...YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO pull the string ....and you will get frustrated real fast....LOL.....Dont Give UP!! I was so happy when it started right away after that...it purred to life on the first pull....WooHoo!!! .....and I didn't get any blisters.....
reviews.author: TJ

reviews.title: "Can't find one that works out of the box"
reviews.text: I bought one to replace an old Craftsman mower that died on me after 15+ years. I went with this one due to price and the fact that I only need it for a couple months before I move to a place where I don't have to mow anymore and didn't want to spend a lot. I grabbed one in a factory sealed box, got it home, started to assemble it and noticed it was missing critical parts, such as the oil cap! So I returned it to the store and exchanged it for another one, also in a factory sealed box. I checked it at the store to make sure it had all the parts, it did, and took it home. I started to put it together when I noticed the handle / wire that does the engine shutoff (whatever it's called) was BROKEN! It shouldn't be this difficult to get one that can be put together and works right out of the box! With the amount of time and gas I've wasted with this, I should have just paid more for a better brand. Don't waste your time and money on this piece of junk.

questions.question: "Bought this over the weekend. Brand new out of the box we can't pull the cord to even finish putting it together. Locks at 6”. Is there some trick?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Em
answers.text: This happened to me a few years ago. I called Craftsman and they were extremely helpful. If you try the other suggestions and still trouble, try removing the spark plug for a minute or two. (I think my recall is correct). It still happens occasionally and this does the trick. Hope this helps. (I know nothing about lawn mowers. My nephew put the mower together but lives out of town. When I went to mow the grass, same problem you described)

answers.author: Analogue23
answers.text: Did pull the handle all the way up & out of the way of the mower blades? Look under the mower & make sure those are out of the way. I don't mean to sound patronizing, but what I did, which I don't always do- is I read the instruction manual & there were things to do that I would not have learned otherwise.

answers.author: Dieter
answers.text: have to pull the handles out more from the mower deck to its full extension....handles are stopping the blades/pull rope from moving

answers.author: JC
answers.text: I bought the same lawnmower and it did the exact same thing to me.

answers.author: Mike
answers.text: First make sure the handle is pulled up so that it's not blocking the blades. Second before trying to pull the cord make sure you add the motor oil to the mower. The added lubrication makes a big difference.

answers.author: MTD
answers.text: Hello. We're sorry to hear that you are having difficulty with the pull-cord of your new lawn mower. Our walk-behind mowers ship in the box with the handle extended down into the blade. First, make sure you remove the T-bolts from the handle brackets and pull the entire handle upward about 6-8 inches so it is no longer blocking the blade. You will need to reattach the T-bolts and wing nuts to secure the handle in the correct position. Thank you for your question!

questions.question: "Does this mower can use gas with ethanol?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Analogue23
answers.text: The instructions on the mower and in the manual specifically state DO NOT USE ETHANOL IN THIS MOWER IT WILL DAMAGE THE ENGINE"

answers.author: Matt
answers.text: In my experience the Craftsman motor does better with super 91 octane. Mine is 8 years old and running well with very few years of maintenance. Enjoy

answers.author: MTD
answers.text: Hello. We recommend using regular 87 octane fuel. Thank you for your question!

questions.question: "Do i need drain the oil or i can just check the oil level and if needed, add oil?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Nick
answers.text: Yes change the oil after first 3-5hr so that the brakend oil has done it's job. Then for safe engine maintenance about every 40 hrs worth . Also drain the tank for the cold months to save the fuel lines as well ...

answers.author: Howie
answers.text: The manual leads one to believe that oil changes may not be necessary, but then mentions changing the oil after the first five hours of use. You decide, but I'd opt for changing the oil.

questions.question: "i just bought this mower put the oil in it fresh gas but it will not start what could be the problem it is brand new"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Julie
answers.text: This is a good and long lasting mower,and I am very hard on mowers. One thing I don't like ,but it's there to save you from harm, is the bar up by the handle ,that must be in gauged or it won't start and it remains down under your hands so when you let go, it stops the mower. This is a safety device. I wouldn't want a mower now with out it.

answers.author: Brian
answers.text: There are a number of things that can cause this issue. THe first thing is check to be sure that the spark plus is a connected. If this is not the issue check that the handles are assembled correctly. After you are sure that all is assembled, be sure that you pull the ignition bar toward the handle and hold them firmly when you pull the cord. Good Luck

questions.question: "Does this mower need assembly or is it fully assembled in the box?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Mike
answers.text: Minor assembly. Mostly putting the handle together and putting the grass bag together. Nothing major.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, it does not come assembled.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, this model is not self-propelled.

answers.author: MTD
answers.text: Hello. The CRAFTSMAN M110 is a push mower. Thank you for your question!

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, it is easy to pull start this mower

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, this mower is not manufactured by MTD.

questions.question: "Can I use my left arm to pull, start this mower"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, you can use your left arm to pull, start this mower.
